summary: An internal email from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) dated August 16, 2019, detailing a significant change in policy regarding the placement of inmates on suicide watch. The memo instructs staff to notify the Captain immediately and notes that the Warden is the approving authority for inmate companions, with inmates no longer able to remain on SHU bed space.

keyFacts: A significant change in suicide watch procedures at MCC was implemented starting August 16, 2019.
When an inmate expresses intentions to harm themselves, the Captain must be notified immediately by phone.
The Warden is the overall approving authority for inmate companions to sit on an inmate placed on suicide watch.
Inmates will no longer be able to remain on SHU (Special Housing Unit) bed space while on suicide watch.
This document is dated August 16, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC custody on August 10, 2019.
